verses.kjv: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verses.ct: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

verses.kjv: The same was in the beginning with God.
verses.ct: He was with God in the beginning.

verses.kjv: All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.
verses.ct: Everything was made through him; nothing that exists was made without him.

verses.kjv: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.
verses.ct: In him was life, and that life was the light of humanity.

verses.kjv: And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.
verses.ct: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has never overcome it.

verses.kjv: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
verses.ct: God sent a man named John.

verses.kjv: The same came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all men through him might believe.
verses.ct: He came as a witness to testify about the Light, so that everyone might believe through him.

verses.kjv: He was not that Light, but was sent to bear witness of that Light.
verses.ct: John himself was not the Light — he was sent to testify about the Light.

verses.kjv: That was the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.
verses.ct: The true Light that gives light to every person was coming into the world.

verses.kjv: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.
verses.ct: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, yet the world did not recognize him.

verses.kjv: He came unto his own, and his own received him not.
verses.ct: He came to his own people, but his own people did not accept him.

verses.kjv: But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, even to them that believe on his name:
verses.ct: Yet to everyone who did accept him — those who put their trust in his name — he gave the right to become children of God.

verses.kjv: Which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
verses.ct: These children were born not through natural descent, nor from human desire or a husband's decision, but from God himself.

verses.kjv: And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace and truth.
verses.ct: The Word became flesh and lived among us. We saw his glory — the glory of the Father's one and only Son — overflowing with grace and truth.

verses.kjv: John bare witness of him, and cried, saying, This was he of whom I spake, He that cometh after me is preferred before me: for he was before me.
verses.ct: John testified about him, calling out, "This is the one I was talking about when I said, 'The one coming after me ranks above me, because he existed before me.'"

verses.kjv: And of his fulness have all we received, and grace for grace.
verses.ct: From his abundance, we have all received one blessing after another.

verses.kjv: For the law was given by Moses, but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: The law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declared him.
verses.ct: No one has ever seen God. The one and only Son, who is closest to the Father's heart, has made him known.

verses.kjv: And this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, Who art thou?
verses.ct: This is John's testimony when the Jewish leaders in Jerusalem sent priests and Levites to ask him, "Who are you?"

verses.kjv: And he confessed, and denied not; but confessed, I am not the Christ.
verses.ct: He stated it plainly and did not dodge the question. He declared, "I am not the Christ."

verses.kjv: And they asked him, What then? Art thou Elias? And he saith, I am not. Art thou that prophet? And he answered, No.
verses.ct: They pressed him, "Then who are you? Are you Elias?" He replied, "I am not." "Are you the Prophet?" He answered, "No."

verses.kjv: Then said they unto him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to them that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?
verses.ct: So they said to him, "Then who are you? We need to bring an answer back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?"

verses.kjv: He said, I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said the prophet Esaias.
verses.ct: He replied, "I am the voice of someone calling out in the wilderness, 'Clear the way for the Lord,' just as the prophet Esaias said."

verses.kjv: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees.
verses.ct: Now the ones who had been sent were from the Pharisees.

verses.kjv: And they asked him, and said unto him, Why baptizest thou then, if thou be not that Christ, nor Elias, neither that prophet?
verses.ct: They questioned him further: "If you are not the Christ, not Elias, and not the Prophet, then why are you baptizing people?"

verses.kjv: John answered them, saying, I baptize with water: but there standeth one among you, whom ye know not;
verses.ct: John answered them, "I baptize with water, but standing among you is someone you don't recognize."

verses.kjv: He it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe’s latchet I am not worthy to unloose.
verses.ct: "He is the one coming after me, and he ranks so far above me that I'm not even worthy to untie his sandals."

verses.kjv: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.
verses.ct: All of this took place in Bethabara on the other side of the Jordan River, where John was baptizing.

verses.kjv: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, Behold the Lamb of God, which taketh away the sin of the world.
verses.ct: The following day, John saw Jesus approaching him and said, "Look — the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!"

verses.kjv: This is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man which is preferred before me: for he was before me.
verses.ct: "This is the one I meant when I said, 'A man is coming after me who ranks above me, because he existed before me.'"

verses.kjv: And I knew him not: but that he should be made manifest to Israel, therefore am I come baptizing with water.
verses.ct: "I didn't know who he was myself, but the reason I came baptizing with water was so that he would be revealed to Israel."

verses.kjv: And John bare record, saying, I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it abode upon him.
verses.ct: Then John gave this testimony: "I watched the Spirit come down from heaven like a dove and rest on him."

verses.kjv: And I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptize with water, the same said unto me, Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: "I wouldn't have recognized him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water told me, 'The man on whom you see the Spirit descend and remain — he is the one who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.'"

verses.kjv: And I saw, and bare record that this is the Son of God.
verses.ct: "I have seen this with my own eyes, and I testify that this is the Son of God."

verses.kjv: Again the next day after John stood, and two of his disciples;
verses.ct: The next day, John was standing there again with 2 of his disciples.

verses.kjv: And looking upon Jesus as he walked, he saith, Behold the Lamb of God!
verses.ct: When he noticed Jesus walking by, he said, "Look — the Lamb of God!"

verses.kjv: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
verses.ct: The 2 disciples heard what he said and started following Jesus.

verses.kjv: Then Jesus turned, and saw them following, and saith unto them, What seek ye? They said unto him, Rabbi, (which is to say, being interpreted, Master,) where dwellest thou?
verses.ct: Jesus turned around and saw them coming after him. He asked, "What are you looking for?" They replied, "Rabbi" (which means Teacher), "where are you staying?"

verses.kjv: He saith unto them, Come and see. They came and saw where he dwelt, and abode with him that day: for it was about the tenth hour.
verses.ct: He told them, "Come and you'll see." So they went with him and saw where he was staying, and they spent the rest of that day with him. It was around 4 in the afternoon.

verses.kjv: One of the two which heard John speak, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
verses.ct: One of the 2 who heard John's testimony and followed Jesus was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.

verses.kjv: He first findeth his own brother Simon, and saith unto him, We have found the Messias, which is, being interpreted, the Christ.
verses.ct: The first thing Andrew did was find his brother Simon and tell him, "We've found the Messias!" (which means the Christ).

verses.kjv: And he brought him to Jesus. And when Jesus beheld him, he said, Thou art Simon the son of Jona: thou shalt be called Cephas, which is by interpretation, A stone.
verses.ct: He brought Simon to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, "You are Simon, son of Jona. You will be called Cephas" (which translates to "A stone").

verses.kjv: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee, and findeth Philip, and saith unto him, Follow me.
verses.ct: The next day, Jesus decided to head to Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, "Follow me."

verses.kjv: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
verses.ct: Philip was from Bethsaida, the same town as Andrew and Peter.

verses.kjv: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.
verses.ct: Philip found Nathanael and told him, "We've found the one Moses wrote about in the Law, and the prophets wrote about too — Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph."

verses.kjv: And Nathanael said unto him, Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip saith unto him, Come and see.
verses.ct: Nathanael responded, "Can anything good come from Nazareth?" Philip said, "Come and see for yourself."

verses.kjv: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and saith of him, Behold an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!
verses.ct: When Jesus saw Nathanael approaching, he said about him, "Now here is a genuine Israelite — a man with no deception in him!"

verses.kjv: Nathanael saith unto him, Whence knowest thou me? Jesus answered and said unto him, Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.
verses.ct: Nathanael asked him, "How do you know me?" Jesus replied, "I saw you under the fig tree before Philip even called you."

verses.kjv: Nathanael answered and saith unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.
verses.ct: Nathanael exclaimed, "Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto him, Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, believest thou? thou shalt see greater things than these.
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "You believe because I told you I saw you under the fig tree? You will see things far greater than that."

verses.kjv: And he saith unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.
verses.ct: Then he told him, "Truly, truly, I tell you — you will see heaven opened and the angels of God going up and coming down on the Son of Man."
